tag_list: social-gaming, developer, virtual-world, avatar, weeworld, social-networking
overview:
Obi Nwosu has a record of delivering user-friendly interfaces through complex Web technology projects.

Drawing on more than 12 years of experience, he currently leads WeeWorldâ€™s engineering team and effectively delivers fun and interactive social media experiences.

Prior to joining WeeWorld, Obi managed the acquisition of Ebookers by Cendant Corp. as Head of E-Solutions, Projects and Development, for Ebookers. In addition, he served as the Deputy CTO and Chief Application Architect for QXL Ricardo, the first major pan-European online auction, as the company grew from a staff of three to 300. Previously, as Head of Development at TSO, one of the leading content management companies in Europe, he managed a variety of technology projects and implemented vital processes to ensure the department consistently delivered.

While a developer at the Delphi Internet section of News International, he conceived and developed the original version of Netropolis, the worldâ€™s first multi-user online sim game, in which the core technology he developed is still in use.
